channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report X-2023081333
item.description:
Report X-2023081333

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 8th, a damaged drum was found leaking during the PM sort. The drum contained UN1268, Petroleum Distillates N.O.S., 3, III. A small amount of the liquid leaked out. The spill was cleaned up and the drum was placed into a steel salvage drum pending disposition.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet. Upon inspection found 1 bottle of Fisher Scientific Isopropanol 70% 4-liter had loose lid resulted to leakage. DescribePack: Bottle had loose lid resulted to leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023080580
item.description:
Report X-2023080580

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived already wet to the station and it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: The plastic bottle of Focus 1% Acid Alcohol leaked from a loose cap causing the shipping box to get wet. The cap was not secured. Only paper was used as inner packing materials. The box used was too big and too much empty space was left inside the of it. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon discovery the wet package was placed in a hazmat bag and bin. No release was found.

item.title: Report E-2023080334
item.description:
Report E-2023080334

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-27
  • City: PENSACOLA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 27, 2023, one (1) 30-gallon drum of UN1791 was punctured by adjacent freight and released approximately two (2) cups of product to the trailer floor and surrounding freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental & Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted surfaces. The spill was cleaned and the damaged 30-gallon drum was overpacked for disposal.

item.title: Report I-2023060057
item.description:
Report I-2023060057

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T00:31:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-18
  • City: RIVIERA BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Water
  • Carrier/Reporter: TROPICAL SHIPPING USA, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Container HLBU1900531 was off loaded by connecting carrier Hapag-Lloyd to Tropical Shipping Vessel. Container was next off loaded in the Port of Palm Beach to be transferred to another vessel to head to it's final destination in Nassau Bahamas and noted to be over weight for equipment capacity. The container was opened to be unstuffed and broken down into two separate containers to safely continue it's transport. Upon opening the container it was noted that blocking and bracing was not used and jerricans of ethanol fell out of the container. There was no hazardous materials declaration form completed nor was the CTU placarded. Shipper info is as follows: SHIPPER: DANIEL BELANDE 37 RUE ST JOSEPH FERMATHE T:+50949084949 HLBU 1900531 (45G1) M: BNCARGO@HOTMAIL.COM
